verses.roman:
utthitās te niśamyātha
vyudakaṁ kalaśaṁ prabho
papracchuḥ kasya karmedaṁ
pītaṁ puṁsavanaṁ jalam

synonyms: utthitāḥ—after awakening; te—all of them; niśamya—seeing; atha—thereafter; vyudakam—empty; kalaśam—the waterpot; prabho—O King Parīkṣit; papracchuḥ—inquired; kasya—whose; karma—act; idam—this; pītam—drunk; puṁsavanam—which was to cause the birth of a child; jalam—water.
translation: When the brāhmaṇas got up from bed and saw the waterpot empty, they inquired who had done this work of drinking the water meant for begetting a child.
